root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill: Consideration of Lords Message
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to two hours (Order of 18 March)

span.style: color: #4d4d4d; font-family: National, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

p.span: Nothing in the Lords Message engages financial privilege.

from_cdata.p: For motions and amendments relating to the Lords Amendments, see separate paper (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill).

p.span: Second Report of the Joint Committee on Human Rights, Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill, HC 435,

from_cdata.p: That this House has considered the postcode lottery of funding for hospices; and calls on integrated care boards to urgently address the funding for hospice-provided palliative care in their areas.
The subject for this debate was determined by the Backbench Business Committee.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 10.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual and gender non-conforming young people: Neale Hanvey

DebateTimingRubric.from_cdata: Westminster Hall will not be sitting.
